attributes.action: apologise to the british electorate for his gross disingenuity during his recent speech to the EU where he said that 'british politicians had the courage to ratify the Lisbon Treaty'.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: He, and everybody else on the planet knows that the Lisbon Treaty was ratified by parliament against the wishes of the electorate of the UK who had been promised a referendum (by him)on the subject before any further integration takes place.  For Gordon Brown to make that statement to the EU without qualifying it with the further - truthful - statement 'against the wishes of the majority of the british voting public despite that we promised to allow them a referendum on the subject'.  Is blatantly being economical with the truth of the matter.

reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
